subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. AM W. 20155 ( 2 ), Turtle Beach, lagoon,
14 Â° 40 'S
,
145 Â° 28 'E
, coll. G. Anderson,
22 Jun 1982
;
MAGNT
W025510, off Casuarina Beach , lagoon of Patch Reef,
14 Â° 40 ' 48 ''S
,
145 Â° 26 ' 42 ''E
, coral rubble, 2 m , coll. N. Bruce,
15 Apr 2008
.

Remarks. The species is most similar to
Hydroides trivesiculosa
Straughan, 1967 b
. According to
Sun et al. 2015
,
H. albiceps
differs from
H. trivesiculosa
in the size and shape of the dorsal verticil spine.
H. trivesiculosa
has an exceptionally large vesicular dorsal verticil spine which is more than 5 times longer than the smaller verticil spines. The lateral outpockets of the dorsal verticil spine are straight in
H . albiceps
, while those of
H . trivesiculosa
are larger and curved ventrally.
Distribution. Red Sea, widely distributed in the Indo-West Pacific.
